paper_abstract: We propose a two-stage phone duration modelling scheme, which can be applied for the improvement of prosody modelli speech synthesis systems. This scheme builds on a number of independent feature constructors (FCs) employed in the first s and a phone duration model (PDM) which operates on an extended feature vector in the second stage. The feature vector, v acts as input to the first stage, consists of numerical and non-numerical linguistic features extracted from text. The extended fe vector is obtained by appending the phone duration predictions estimated by the FCs to the initial feature vector. Experiment the American-English KED TIMIT and on the Modern Greek WCL-1 databases validated the advantage of the proposed two-scheme, improving prediction accuracy over the best individual predictor, and over a two-stage scheme which just fuses the first-outputs. paper_title: Two-stage phone duration modelling with feature construction and feature vector extension for the needs of speech synthesis
